text: Fernando Fabián Fernández Acosta (born 8 January 1992) is a Paraguayan professional footballer who plays as a forward for Guaraní. ==Career== Fernando began its journey from very small to become a player in football school called Cooperative Capiatá, later to move to Martín Ledesma their city natal. At the age of 13 years came to Guaraní, through each of the smaller categories before making his debut in the First Division in 2013.https://web.archive.org/web/20141229081759/http://www.lanacion.com.py/articulo/166746 --fernando-fernandez-el-delantero-mas-letal-del-futbol-casero.html In December 2015, Fernández was transferred to Mexican side Tigres UANL.http://www.univision.com/deportes/futbol/tigres/fernando-fernandez-nuevo- refuerzo-de-tigres On 24 January 2016, he scored his first goal with Tigres in a 2–2 draw against Chivas de Guadalajara at the Estadio Omnilife. On 27 January 2017, Tigres announced that Fernández had been transferred to Club Olimpia in a 6-month loan deal. ==Honours== ;UANL *Liga MX: Apertura 2016 * Campeón de Campeones: 2016 ==References== Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:Paraguayan footballers Category:Paraguayan expatriate footballers Category:Club Guaraní players Category:Tigres UANL footballers Category:Club Olimpia footballers Category:Paraguayan Primera División players Category:Liga MX players Category:Expatriate footballers in Mexico Category:Association football forwards
title: Fernando Fernández (Paraguayan footballer)
